result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Lee Colletti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda Lee Colletti

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda Lee Colletti in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.  

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   Additional statement by John M.

Court ordered defendant to serve 115 days in the House of Correction, with 115 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $250.00 to be paid to Glendale Police Department.  

The Court objects to expungement.  

- No DNA sample or DNA surcharge is ordered on this case as it has been ordered on case 15CF4421.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages.  If revoked on case 15CF4421, as a condition of ES.  To be paid by the end of probation in case 15CF4421.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Amanda Lee Colletti in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel advised the Court that Judge Pocan has agreed to accept this case as part of a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Case scheduled in Branch 26 on March 9, 2016 at 1:30 pm for possible resolution with defendant's other pending case 15CF4421.

Defendant Amanda Lee Colletti in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Oral No Contact Order with CO John Miller.

Defendant Amanda Lee Colletti in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Amanda Lee Colletti in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Parties reviewed report.  Parties do not challenge the report.  the defendant agrees she is competent to proceed.  Court finds the defendant competent and orders the proceedings reinstated.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda Lee Colletti in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant Amanda Lee Colletti in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for return on doctor's report.  The defendant challenges the report.  Case passed.

CASE RECALLED.  SAME APPEARANCES.
TAPE#10:56
Statements made.  Case passed.

CASE RECALLED.  SAME APPEARANCES.
TAPE#11:02
The defendant's request for new counsel is denied by the Court.  The court will proceed with a competency hearing.  Case passed.

CASE RECALLED.  SAME APPEARANCES.
COURT REPORTER:  CINDY DOBBS.

Competency hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Dr. John Pankiewicz.  Parties stipulate to the doctor's credentials.  State rests.  Defense calls no witnesses.  Court adopts the report of Dr. Pankiewicz.  Court finds the defendant not competent but likely to regain competency with treatment.  Court ordered the defendant committed to DHS for treatment to restore competency.  Court finds the involuntary administration of medication(s) and treatment is needed because the defendant is incapable of expressing an understanding of the advantages and disadvantages of accepting medication or treatment and the alternatives.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  DHS is authorized to administer medication(s) or treatment to the defendant and shall observe appropriate medical standards in doing so; order signed, filed and distrbuted.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 24.  Review hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

The defendant has a pending felony before Judge Pocan, Branch 26.  Attorney Mathers handled hearing in Branch 26.  The defendant was sent back to the jail and due to her conduct was not able to be brought back to this branch.  Case adjourned to October 28, 2015 at 8:30 am for return on doctor's report.
Per request of the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Court signed an amended order adding language requested.

Defendant Amanda Lee Colletti in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Amanda Lee Colletti in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  LM

Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant is in custody. File sent to in-custody court.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 8/28/15 @ 1:30 pm
